intro: Chloraea aurantiaca var. crocata, commonly known as the golden chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open forests and heathlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds.
